intro: Spiesia sewerzowii, commonly known as the velvetleaf. This plant is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Spiesia sewerzowii is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
